item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Sarah add a quote by L. M. Montgomery
item.description: "I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers." -- L. M. Montgomery

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "I said to the sun, ‘Tell me about the big bang.’ The sun said, ‘it hurts to become." -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description:
"You know," Gabriel said, "there was a time I thought we could be friends, Will."
"There was a time I thought I was a ferret," Will said, "but that turned out to be the opium haze. Did you know it had that effect? Because I didn't." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "Let me also say I wanna make you sandwhiches, And soup, And peanut butter cookies, Though, the truth is peanutbutter is actually really bad for you 'cause they grow peanuts in old cotton fields to clean the toxins out of the soil, But hey, you like peanutbutter and I like you!" -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Andrea Gibson
item.description: "You have a heart of gold and I am kneeling in your bloodstream panning for the only thing that has ever felt like home." -- Andrea Gibson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "Let others praise ancient times; I am glad I was born in these." -- Ovid

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "Really, being a librarian is a much more dangerous job than you realize." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "I love you for who you are, not who the world thinks you should be." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "Because 'You're perfect just the way you are,' is what your guidance counselor says. And she's an alcoholic." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "I don’t care. If I like somebody, I like her, and that’s that.” He thumped his chest and made a scowly face. “Let ‘em come for me. I will stare down the mob with their pitchforks! I will make a speech about tolerance and love. I will tell them the folly of their ways! And then I will grab your hand and run like hell because, Jesus, a mob with pitchforks?" -- Libba Bray

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "The worst part of holding the memories is not the pain. It's the loneliness of it. Memories need to be shared." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description:
"I liked the feeling of love,' [Jonas] confessed. He glanced nervously at the speaker on the wall, reassuring himself that no one was listening. 'I wish we still had that,' he whispered. 'Of course,' he added quickly, 'I do understand that it wouldn't work very well. And that it's much better to be organized the way we are now. I can see that it was a dangerous way to live.'
...'Still,' he said slowly, almost to himself, 'I did like the light they made. And the warmth." -- Lois Lowry
